name: Rodeway Inn South

reviews.text: We stayed at the South Rodeway Inn for two nights after July 4th. The decision to stay there based entirely on price - this was the cheapest option when we were going to be in Sandusky.
reviews.title: Not as bad as the horror stories

likes.disliked: — I had low expectations, and they were easily met.

reviews.text: From the most of the reviews I read, I was expecting a filthy flea bag dump with mysterious stains and various vermin on every surface. I did not find that. Let's be clear - this is not a four star resort (or even a two star Holiday Inn). It's a one star hotel built and last updated in the Kennedy administration.
reviews.title: Very Friendly and Clean

likes.disliked: — Didn't accept my travelers checks and the cable went out one night.

reviews.text: But for what it lacked in charm, it was clean, quiet, safe, and above all, affordable. If you want or need more amenities spend the extra money. But if you're looking for a bed, a shower, a pool, and some extra money to spend at Cedar Point, this is a decent destination.
reviews.title: Poor hotel, good location

likes.disliked: — Lack of security and age/condition of property

reviews.text: Tip - we didn't even bother with the continental breakfast. Instead we walked next door to Jolly Donuts, a local joint with hot breakfasts and some great homemade donuts.
reviews.title: About as expected

reviews.text: Family and I stayed 4 nights. We were greeted by a very friendly employee who seemed happy to serve us and made us feel important. The rooms were very clean and comparable to other motels I have stayed at. They have a free shuttle to and from Cedar Point which is a big plus (saves on the $10 parking fee and traffic congestion). The breakfast was good (coffee, juice, donuts). Overall nice stay and I would stay again.
reviews.title: Do not stay here unles you like liers and uncleanlyness
Not a 2 star!
reviews.text: I booked this through Hotwire, not realizing I was being sent to a very dirty, scary hotel in Sandusky. Very small, single bed, cramped, mold, dirt, hair, used toothpaste glob in sink, etc. Old peeling paint, cracked tiles from the 1950's. Amenitites listed through Hotwire were non-existent (business center, golf, pool), and there is no way this is a 2 star hotel. I checked out 10 minutes after I checked in, there was no way I could stay there, and I am not a picky person.

reviews.title: Too many bugs
reviews.text: This hotel stinks only thing good about it was the shuttle. My family and I (which is 2 adults and 2 children ages 8 and 9) stayed here for two horrible nights with a bathroom filled with bugs and ants all over the windows and floors. We asked the front desk help that if someone could come clean up the room and no one spoke english. When we came back for the park we found beer cans and cigarettes infront of our room. We went inside the our room and find another couple in there too. Went back to the main office and told them about the people in our room and they said we must have overbooked the rooms. we asked for our money back. The only thing came out good for this was they sent us to Breakers Express on them and the shuttle!!!!

reviews.title: complete dump!!!!!!!
reviews.text: most filthy hole in the wall I have ever had the displeasure of paying for! don't believe anything but negative comments about this dive! no coffee maker,ice bucket or toilett paper in room but they did provide a 8 to 10 legged masscot in the bathtub that I wouldn't use! sleep in you're car first!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.title: Better than before, good for the cheap
reviews.text: Having stayed at this motel a few times before, and not being too impressed, I did my best to choose other places. After a few years having gone elsewhere to stay for my Cedar Point visits, a friend booked the Rodeway South for the CoasterMania weekend coaster enthusiast event at Cedar Point in June Since I wasn't booking, and needed to cut the costs down, I thought this would be a reasonable option.

reviews.title: Not so horrible, but not great either...
reviews.text: We arrived at around 9 PM Thursday night, and one snag was already hit - the computer resevation system went down, so it took a bit of time to check in, and this was done manually and would get figured out by the time we checked out.

reviews.title: Don't waste your money
reviews.text: The beds were the hardest I've ever tried to sleep on. Unbelievably hard.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No exhaust in the bathroom. Paint was bubbling and peeling. I wouldn't be suprised if mold was growing.
reviews.title: Not Bad
Stay away!
reviews.text: No smoke alarm, but the wiring and mounting bracket was in installed. The front desk did not know if there should be smoke alarms in the rooms.

reviews.title: Totally Unacceptable
reviews.text: Gate was broken on the swimming pool. No lighting in the pool area, though it was open until 11 pm.
Very disappointed. Yes, they were the cheapest, and yes, I got what I paid for. Too bad, it is in a great location.
reviews.title: Good stay

reviews.text: The picture of the room on their website is accurate, but old. The rooms have seen some use since the picture was taken. B/C of it's price, it must attract the wrong type of people. You do get what you pay for. We saw profanity carved into doors inside one room and on the sidewalk, and we could still see words that had been painted over on the bedroom wall of a different unit when the light hit it right. The pool looked dirty & there were no umbrellas available. The ice machine was broken. If you are on a tight budget & can bear with the problems, the rooms seemed clean enough. The staff was okay & changed our room when we complained. The breakfast was coffee, juice, and donuts. If you can afford it, spend a little more and stay somewhere else. I thought that since it was a Choice hotel, it would be nicer, just without a lot of perks. I was disappointed.
reviews.title: Can't believe this is a Choice hotel

reviews.text: Dh and I stayed the memorial day weeked there during our trip to Cedar Point and was not disappointed at all. The Hotel staff was polite, the room was wonderful. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Will stay there again!!!
Rooms will vary!!!!
reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel last year, and the year before! We had a nice stay, and although we have certain standards, we also understand how old this hotel is! I am 29 years old, and use to stay here all the time with my family when I was little because we had a yearly trip to Cedar Point every year! I cannot complain about this hotel. Except one time we needed more towels, which we got, and our tv remote didn't work! We just got off our butts and changed the channel manually! If you don't want to spend alot of money, and you want a clean place to sleep and shower, (because for the most part you'll be at Cedar Point anyway!), this is the place to stay. I'm sure there are certain staff members and rooms that aren't so appealing to people at times, but you will have that no matter where you stay! Even at the resort hotels! Every hotel is different and even the nicer ones have crappy rooms and sometimes crappy service! And apparently crappy, overly picky customers!!!! Just stop complaining and go fork our over $100 a night for a Cedar Point Area hotel or $300-$400 a night for a resort hotel, and then post your opinion! I think you'll find you were much happier having the extra money you saved with your rate here, than what you'd pay somewhere else so you can spend more at Cedar Point! And if you have kids, you know what I'm saying!!!! Have a nice day!!

reviews.title: get over it --!!
reviews.text: I have a wife and four kids, I booked cheap so we could have more money for the park and attractions. The pool there was awsome, the manager Rhonda was awsome, yes it needs updated but who cares when your just sleeping there! It's old but clean, So if you don't need satian sheets and charman toliet paper stay here!!

reviews.title: Absolutely Horrible!
reviews.text: DON'T STAY HERE! This place was the nastiest, trashiest motel I've ever seen. Reserved room online. BIG MISTAKE! If you like mold, mildew, rotting drywall, falling ceilings, electrical problems, dirty rooms, dirty pool and rude staff this place is for you. ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING! Room looked nothing like the pictures online. Dirty linens, rotting, water damaged & moldy drywall in the bathroom. Mold on the walls in the room. Ceiling was falling down... Oh yes, and I have pictures to prove it! I wouldn't leave my dog here for an hour. Our vacation was ruined since we had to drive around for 7 hours trying to find a decent hotel!

description: Rodeway Inn South has been recently remodeled, with all new carpet, new paint, and all new linens in all rooms. We offer free WI-FI, seasonal outdoor pool, Express breakfast, coffee, juice, and aastry from 6am through 9am every morning. We are just 2 miles from Cedar Point, across the street from Goofy Golf, and minutes from many restaurants!
